linear_algebra_books.description: Linear Algebra - Foundational textbooks and materials on vectors, matrices, eigenvalues, and linear transformations

items.title: Introduction to Linear Algebra (Gilbert Strang, 5th Edition)
items.notes: Classic MIT textbook by Gilbert Strang. Covers fundamental concepts with clear explanations.

items.title: Linear Algebra Done Right (Sheldon Axler, 3rd Edition)
items.notes: Focuses on vector spaces and linear maps rather than matrices. Freely available from author's website.

calculus_books.description: Calculus & Analysis - Single and multivariable calculus, differential equations, and real analysis

items.title: Calculus (Gilbert Strang)
items.notes: Free calculus textbook from MIT OpenCourseWare. Comprehensive coverage of single and multivariable calculus.

items.title: APEX Calculus (Gregory Hartman et al.)
items.notes: Free, open-source calculus textbook covering Calculus I, II, and III.

items.title: Vector Calculus (Michael Corral)
items.notes: Focused treatment of vector calculus and multivariable topics. Shorter, more specialized text.

items.title: Elementary Differential Equations (William F. Trench)
items.notes: Comprehensive introduction to ordinary differential equations with many examples.

numerical_optimization_books.description: Numerical Methods & Optimization - Algorithms for optimization, numerical linear algebra, and computational methods

items.title: Numerical Optimization (Nocedal & Wright, 2nd Edition)
items.notes: The standard reference for numerical optimization. Comprehensive and rigorous.

items.title: Convex Optimization (Boyd & Vandenberghe)
items.notes: Classic Stanford textbook on convex optimization. Essential for understanding modern ML optimization.

items.title: Algorithms for Optimization (Kochenderfer & Wheeler)
items.notes: Modern treatment with Julia code examples. Covers gradient-free and gradient-based methods.

items.title: Numerical Linear Algebra (Trefethen & Bau)
items.notes: Concise introduction to numerical methods for linear algebra. Note: Check if PDF is available; may need to find alternative source.

items.title: First-Order Methods in Optimization (Beck)
items.notes: Sample chapter on gradient descent and related methods. Highly relevant for deep learning.

machine_learning_books.description: Machine Learning Theory - Foundational textbooks on statistical learning, pattern recognition, and ML theory

items.title: The Elements of Statistical Learning (Hastie, Tibshirani, Friedman)
items.notes: Classic Stanford textbook on statistical learning. Comprehensive coverage of traditional ML methods.

items.title: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning (Bishop)
items.notes: Comprehensive Bayesian approach to machine learning. Dense but authoritative.

items.title: Understanding Machine Learning: From Theory to Algorithms (Shalev-Shwartz & Ben-David)
items.notes: Theoretical foundations with focus on computational learning theory.

items.title: Mathematics for Machine Learning (Deisenroth, Faisal, Ong)
items.notes: Covers the mathematical foundations: linear algebra, analytic geometry, matrix decompositions, probability, and optimization.

deep_learning_books.description: Deep Learning - Comprehensive textbooks on neural networks, deep learning architectures, and modern techniques

items.title: Deep Learning (Goodfellow, Bengio, Courville)
items.notes: The definitive deep learning textbook. Note: Website provides HTML; PDF may need alternative source.

items.title: Neural Networks and Deep Learning (Michael Nielsen)
items.notes: Accessible introduction with interactive visualizations. Great for beginners.

items.title: Dive into Deep Learning (Zhang et al.)
items.notes: Modern interactive book with code in PyTorch, TensorFlow, and JAX. Regularly updated.
